Text: Grrr... why do people continue to use .RAR when packing videos? The added compression is marginal, and it just means that the end user (moi) has to reserve twice as much hard disk space if we actually want to view them, or share them over a local network.

I agree don't rar and we can pick individual files not everything. if there is a mistake with the one rar file then everything is lost, but jpg files if you loose 10 out of 100 you still have 90 good files. RAR files suck
